title: Daniel Bryan suffers neck injury scare after match at WWE Hell in a Cell
text:
Daniel Bryan collapsed on the ramp and held his neck after his match at WWE Hell in a Cell (WWE)

Daniel Bryan suffered an injury scare following his match with Roman Reigns at WWE Hell in a Cell.

Bryan and Reigns won their match at Sunday’s PPV event in a tornado tag-team match against Luke Harper and Erick Rowan.

During the match, Bryan suffered a nasty fall from on top of the announcers’ table after he countered his way out of a powerbomb.

Reigns sealed the win as he hit a spear on Harper just after Bryan had hit him with the running knee.

Bryan and Reigns hugged in the ring but Bryan raised concerns about his injury as he made his way backstage.

The television camera only caught a brief glimpse but Bryan was seen holding his neck and collapsing to his knees before cutting back to Reigns, who was hobbling as he left the ring.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Bryan has already undergone neck surgery in 2014 which kept him out of the ring for eight months.

The 38-year-old initially retired in 2016 after medical tests had showed that he had suffered a brain lesion as a result of multiple concussions during his career.

Bryan made his return to the ring at WrestleMania 34 last year after he was finally cleared to compete by medical staff.
